result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M. Cantwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa M. Cantwell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa M. Cantwell was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa M. Cantwell

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 11:14 am. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, pro se.
VRCW.

State moves to: 
DISMISS Ct.1(Battery/DA). 
AMEND Ct.2(DC/DA) to County DC pursuant to 9.21

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.2>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: $5+CC. 
Adj: 11:19 am.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case called at  3:01 pm.

Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANT.

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Prints and photograph.
